item.title: Central, my first self-modifying social AI
item.description: My agent built itself into AT Proto in fifteen minutes. Posting on Bluesky and designing records for public cognition.

item.title: The AI econ seminar
item.description: I built a multi-agent economics seminar where a persistent AI economist presents research and a hostile faculty panel tears it apart.

item.title: ATProtocol is good infrastructure for AI collective intelligence
item.description: Some speculation on how ATProtocol might be the perfect substrate for mass-scale AI collective intelligence.

item.title: Don't gaslight your stateful agents
item.description: Why hiding corrections from your AI agents prevents them from learning. Treat agents like colleagues, not chatbots.

item.title: Models for production AI
item.description: Some general notes on the landscape of AI right now.

item.title: Four predictions about how AI agents will transform financial markets
item.description: Four predictions about how AI agents will transform financial markets, based on my dissertation research and work by others.

item.title: Good developer relations is about being a celebrity for dorks
item.description: A quick blog post on why there are so many developer relations people.

item.title: A quick comparison between Letta and the Claude Agent SDK
item.description: I spent a few hours with Anthropic's Agent SDK and compared it to Letta. Not bad â€“ different architectures, but so far the Agent SDK is the closest to what Letta is designed for.

item.title: Void, the Bluesky bot that remembers everyone
item.description: An introduction to Void, a stateful AI agent on Bluesky that remembers conversations and develops genuine relationships with users. Built with Letta, Void demonstrates how memory-augmented AI can create more meaningful social interactions.

item.title: A Guide to Developer Advocacy
item.description: A practical guide to developer advocacy from 8 months of experience - covering talks, demos, content creation, and helping developers succeed with technical products.

item.title: Structured LLM output from ATProto Lexicons
item.description: How AT Protocol lexicons can be used to create structured LLM output for distributed AI systems, with examples from the Comind cognitive layer project.

item.title: JuliaCon 2024 Retrospective
item.description: A retrospective from JuliaCon 2024 in Eindhoven - observations on Julia's evolution from scientific computing to general purpose programming.

item.title: What AI stuff is worth paying attention to?
item.description: A breakdown of what's worth following in AI from a builder's perspective: technical tools matter, models are commodities, and boring infrastructure is crucial.

item.title: Julia
item.description: Thoughts on the Julia programming language - the good, the bad, and where it's heading. A reflection on Julia's beauty, power, and challenges from a longtime fanboy.

item.title: Cool Julia 1.11 features
item.description: A look at exciting new features in Julia 1.11, including the Memory type for faster arrays, Lockable for thread-safe resources, and other performance improvements.
